intro: Caroxylon swakopmundi, commonly known as the Swakopmund tree, is a unique member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a deciduous tree native to the Namib Desert in Namibia, characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to access groundwater, enabling survival in arid conditions. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against extreme temperatures and herbivory. Caroxylon swakopmundi plays a vital role in the desert ecosystem, offering shelter and food to various desert species.
